events.title: 3D camera
events.description: Enable this group to see the game from a first-person perspective.

children.text: On the start of the game the 'RoundOver' boolean is set to true.
Always set a 3D camera parallel to the layout with the position and angle of the Player sprite.

When 'EnemyCount' is equal to 0, the 'RoundOver' Boolean is set to true which then switches to on screen text. Then once 'Q' is pressed, 1 is added to global number 'CurrentRound' and when 'CurrentRound' is equal to the new number (e.g., 1+1 is 2) then the function will spawn a new 'EnemyType' and will play a new 'LoopCount' (which is the number of enemies in the round). The move to condition causes the bosses to move towards the player.
When overlord spawns it will follow the player, and every 3 seconds it will spawn a fire ball that damages the player
When the Archdemon spawns it will follow the player and deploy 2 different types of file bullets.
If round is over, the intermission will be visible, if not then intermission will be invisible

events.title: 2D camera
events.description: Enable this group to see the game from a top-down 2D perspective.

children.text: In 2D mode, just scroll to the player normally. Also set all the billboards to show their back faces instead of their right faces, to make it clearer what is going on.

events.title: General
events.description: Event blocks that implement the gameplay regardless of the type of view.

children.text: On start of layout the controls are visible, when q is pressed text goes invisible
Always make the enemy objects look towards the player, for a billboard style appearance.

Shoot bullets when pressing spacebar. Note the bullet is also a 3D shape using just the right face for a billboard style appearance. It is also Z elevated slightly so it comes out just below the player's viewpoint.
When a bullet collides with the scenery, destroy it.
When a bullet collides with a enemy, subtracts from health, make it flash, and destroy the bullet
If a enemy gets hit by a bullet a certain amount of times, destroy it and create a "puff" billboard in its place as a disappearing animation (the "puff" object has the Fade behavior so it fades out).

events.text: The function has 2 parameters and uses both, "EnemyType" decides which enemy to spawn and the "LoopCount" chooses how many enemies to spawn.

children.text: enemy was spawned over the wall.
These events/actions is what allows the audio to be played
